entry.title: Combined summary - [ANNOUNCE] BitCoinJ v0.2
entry.summary: The email announces the release of BitCoinJ v0.2, which includes over 100 commits since the first release in March. The new version offers full support for block chain re-orgs and recognition of dead transactions that will never be included in the chain. Additionally, it features persistence of the block chain using multiple pluggable stores, including a BoundedOverheadBlockStore suitable for usage on mobile devices where low memory usage and instant startup time are requirements. Other updates include IRC, DNS, and seed list peer discovery, ASN.1 key export, many bug fixes, and minor API improvements. The release is the work of many individuals, including Andreas Schildbach, Miron Cuperman, Gary Rowe, Thilo Planz, Micheal Swiggs, Noa Resare, John Sample, and Xiaofeng Guo. The announcement was also sent to the bitcoin-development mailing list. Finally, the email ends with a message from Jim congratulating the team on their work.Google Switzerland GmbH is a subsidiary of Google LLC, operating in the country since 2004. The company's headquarters are located in Zurich and it has around 2,000 employees in the country. Google Switzerland is responsible for sales, marketing, and administrative operations in Switzerland.In addition to its business operations, Google Switzerland is also committed to supporting the local community through various initiatives. The company has partnered with several organizations to provide digital skills training to Swiss citizens, and has donated millions of dollars to support education and research in the country. One such initiative is the Digital Workshop program, which provides free training on topics such as online marketing, data analytics, and website development to individuals and small businesses. Another program, called Code Club Switzerland, aims to teach children how to code and foster an interest in technology from a young age.Google Switzerland has also established partnerships with universities and research institutions in the country, providing funding and support for projects related to computer science, artificial intelligence, and other areas of research. The company has also invested in renewable energy projects in Switzerland, including a solar power plant in the canton of Valais.Overall, Google Switzerland plays an important role in the country's economy and society, providing employment opportunities, supporting local initiatives, and contributing to research and development in various fields.
